mads.note: Anonyme Kirchengeschichte, 2002: t.p. (Gelasius Cyzicenus) p. v (this fifth-century church history, which bears the Greek title Syntagma, was attributed for centuries to a certain Gelasius of Cyzicus) p. ix (in the extant manuscripts, the author never refers to himself by name; the name Gelasius was mistakenly assigned to the author by the philologist François Pithou when he edited the first printed edition in 1599)

"Gelasius, of Cyzicus Anonymous church historian, A work handed down in the MSS as anonymous and usually under the title of σύνταγμα τῶν κατὰ τὴν ἐν Νικαίᾳ ἁγίαν σύνοδον πραχθέντων (‘summary of the events at the holy synod in Nicaea’) about the Church history of the east under Constantinus...." Markschies, Christoph (Berlin). “Gelasius”, in: Brill’s New Pauly, Antiquity volumes edited by: Hubert Cancik and , Helmuth Schneider. Consulted online on 18 October 2016
Historia ecclesiastica, 2008: t.p. (Anonymus von Cyzicus) p. 7 (the author, whose name is unknown, was mistakenly assigned the name Gelasius by the editor of the first printed edition of 1599)
